{"step_by_step_thinking": "The drug that is known to interact with cheese and other dairy products is Tetracycline. Tetracycline belongs to a class of antibiotics called tetracyclines, and it can form insoluble complexes with calcium found in dairy products. This can reduce the absorption of the drug and decrease its effectiveness. Therefore, patients taking Tetracycline should avoid consuming cheese and other dairy products.", "answer_choice": "A"}
